name: April Thorpe
text: Never know what you will find! Staff is so sweet and helpful! Reasonable prices, one of my main thrift shop stops!!!

name: Faye Barnard
text: Good. Bargains. Lots.  Furniture

name: Alfredo Herrera
text: Seen a couple asking for food an they said no because they didn't have proof of income. So sad.

name: Lisa Ki
text: This is a mens rescue shelter not a donation station...

name: Don Bloomfield
text: Good quality, but greeedy

name: Ben Wicker
text: Big place .

name: rick bell
text: Helpful place

name: LeighAnn Gunter
text: Good place.

name: Jibrael Escott
text: Great place for the mentally challenged. Great group of men to work with. We are making great strides.

name: Nathaniel Smith
text: For those in need of care for self or loved ones. Loving and patient staff.

name: Craig Winn
text: Way to go Fire House for sheltering my cousin in his time of need. He sings your praises and so do I.  The place is a dump in a terrible area of town but it is working to care for the physical well being for some housing challenges folks.

name: Wesley Watts
text: IT'S  MEANT  WHAT  IT MEANS.  A SAFE  HAVEN.

name: James Pittman
text: This is the last place that you would ever want to be or place a family member with mental health issues. The place has bed bugs. Most of the porches are falling apart. The staff practices discrimination on a daily basis. Clients are treated like second class citizens!

name: Wes Stewart
text: Saving the lives of the emotionally disturbed and sick

name: Johnny Moody
text:
(Translated by Google) N / A

(Original)
N/A

name: Tom L
text: i stayed there but was kicked out because a female who was staying there decided to get a hotel room for the night n let me crash on the floor. They found out n booted me.

name: Mary Hamilton
text: I am 63 and disabled and had to walk to get walk because the Adult Protective services would not assist with transportation. And I had hoped to obtain some of the Project Share Funds and some items of furniture so that I would not have to sleep on the cold floor in my physical condition but after finally making it to the Rescue Mission I thought I was going to be turned away because I was informed that the appointment was for the 14th. I tried to explain that I had tried to explain that when I had called that it was on the 14th as that was the day that the Dothan Utilities had turned my services off and was told by the Rescue Mission to come in on the following Tuesday on the 19th the day that I arrive for my appointment. I had a bill for for over$ 300 due 2//2/2021 but the Rescue Mission just gave me a voucher in the value of $70 good for only a period of ten (10) days but the remaining balance must balance must be paid before the voucher can be be used to pay for the last  $70.00 that are owed on the bill before the voucher can be used and the voucher is only good for a total of ten days after which it it becomes void.  I explained to the Rescue Mission employee that I lived on SSI disability benefits and that I received my benefits on the first of the each month and that the $ $70..00 voucher would expire before my disability benefits would arrive next month and she said that she could not help that and that. I told her that I had been sleeping on the floor and that that my funds had been stolen from my bank account and most of my stimulus payment had been stolen from my my home that I had to pay my rent and utilities with.again I asked if there was any way that I could try to obtain a couch to sleep on because my neighbor and I had experienced an bed .bud invasion and that I desperately needed something to sleep on instead of the floor that it was just getting very  difficut and painful for my condolences. She just told me to have a good day.

name: Kevin Willis
text: Nice place full of hate need better management more hate than love

name: Bella Lovely
text: Do not come here to stay, there's mole in the bathroom and they don't care. There is water leaking in from the rain, in the rooms. There is crack in the foundation and when it's cold out side she doesn't not turn the heat on. You have about six blankets on the bed just to stay  warm and clothes the vents. When it is raining outside she will tell you to leave and the men gets to stay in when it's raining but not the women, they have to walk the streets in the rain. The lounge manager has a nasty attitude, she's gets a attitude for no reason. She doesn't come out of room to interact with anyone unless it's Brad. Only certain people gets to stay in all day unless she likes you.

name: Linda Fryer
text:
One of my favorite places. It help run the mission for men and women, feed and cloth them. You can have a roof over yr head. Their are two Missions in Dothan #1 n #2 call either and get the scoop
YR LOCAL GUIDE

name: MONICA L BROWN
text: They really help slot of people and they try to meet everyone's quota. Beautiful people too. Especially Mrs. Lisa who works herself to the bone.

name: Faith.Royalty Princesa
text: Who all got bit with bed bugs at this place. The lady shows favoritism (Ms. Tracy) Mr. Bradley listens to everything Ms. Tracy says. I was biten up and kicked out. These people have Godly churches to come out but have NOTHING of God dwelling inside their hearts. I followed the rules and I was treated wrongly because I have a nice vehicle and the men were attracted to me there (The leader was very jealous). For someone who was homeless IN THE SAME FACILITY only a year ago how could someone throw out a 26 yr female at 5am because she spoke up about bed bugs. Please comment if you would like to sign my paperwork stating you were bite as well.

name: Yvonna Bartley
text: Great selection

name: John Riseling
text: Good people there they help you a lot when needed!!

name: ClaraJane Rainey
text: Love this store. No telling what you are about to find there. From antiques to toys to some off the wall odd item. Prices are reasonable. Customer service is great.

name: Gary Seward
text: You got to work and volunteer for free. If you don't do it you are kicked out on the street even if your health prevents you to work. No love there at all. They won't even help you to get a job or a place to live. But that place always talks about God and do ungodly things.. Don't go words to live by!!!!

name: Gerald Robert Mendoza
text: One of the most horrible places to stay at in Alabama ,if your homeless. The only thing that it has going for it , is that it has a large concentration of great churches that support and feed the residents. So far ,in my experience , all homeless missions, fall short of being pillars of hope. Some of these leaders in these missions ,can't even recite a verse from the bible , let alone, know the words to the hymns. So, in other words, I'd recommend a cardboard box out in the boonies.

name: roger jerrell
text: Dothan Rescue Mission Should not even be funded,they don't try to help no one but theirselves! If you have a new car they're right there for you but if you and your wife who has had bypass surgery walk 7.5 miles carrying everything you own on your back in 90 degree heat they turn you away knowing your 590 miles from home and have no where to turn! Thanks for being such Christian people Dothan Rescue Mission I'm sure if I ever treat people so bad I'll need all of real Christian people on Earth and Heaven praying for me just to keep me from ever turnal damnation! God Bless You all and may God have forgiveness on your list souls!

name: Denise Cheek
text: It was a nice place and i met some real nice people too

name: Jordan Lopez
text: The staff is awesome and the shelter is a safe place to stay for those that have no where to go

name: Judy Simonson
text: Strict but a safe place to stay until you get back on your feet

name: Jessica Williams
text: The structures are sound! I support what they do for others!

name: Robert Snell
text: I was never sleep there i just ate there its very nice when you don't have food or no where to stay or sleep. Am Robert S i say yes on there and put your in a good place.

name: Amanda McNeill
text: One of the best places to go for help if you're homeless and willing to follow some rules...it is an amazing place!

name: William Cogburn
text: This place is awsome they have helped me in so many ways the staff is awesome and extremely helpful God bless the dothan rescue mission.....thanks pop,mark, and tyrek

name: Tanya Lyste
text: Very courteous and helpful gets you where you need to be

name: bobby underwood
text: Blessed.      Food     and. Church

name: Danny Kendrick Jr
text: Great place good people love friendly people!

name: Kirkland Alliman
text: I'm a resident right now. Glory to god, I'm looking for a place of my own at the moment.

name: lord H
text: The staff are rude nasty and treat you like their slaves.

name: Bobby Underwood
text: its my faviorite best friends food service

name: Philip Hardy
text: It works if you work it!

name: Steve Onley
text: Very good people

name: Bill Noble
text: It's ok except they DEMAND that you take part in all their chapel meets and prayer session which are daily or they kick you out. This to me doesn't seem very Christian

name: Michael Olson
text: Great place for homeless people

name: Amy Bynum
text: I have shopped at this store for years and it's 1 of my favorite ones in dothan to shop at.

name: Lora Salmon
text: Good people

name: Beth Brown
text: Nice place

name: Renee Gibson
text: Always a good place to go for help

name: Scott Burton
text: Clean. Friendly staff. fellowship

name: Debra See
text: Hot meals and clean shelter

name: Nicole Exum Creel
text: Great staff!

name: Jack Metzger
text: Not friendly rude staff

name: Cathy Russaw

name: JAROD BENNETT
text: I would starve to death without all there great food I have never gone Hungary because of the rescue mission and other great organizations in Dothan
